ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Active status
Notes: 0=Inactive-Data collected after the 14 month treatment phase/after early termination from treatment phase/prior to treatment phase; 1=Active-Data collected during the 14 month treatment phase while subject received originally assigned treatment regardless of degree of compliance; 2=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to violate treatment arm by receiving alternate treatment; 3=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to leave the study by moving away;4=Yes, Active; 5=No, Not Active

ElementDescription: Site
Subject type
Notes: 1=MTA randomized trial subject; 2=Local normative comparison group (LNCG) subject

ElementDescription: If you ask your child to do something and s/he does not do it, do you give up trying to get him/her to do it?
If you warn your child that s/he will be punished if s/he does not stop doing something, do you actually punish him/her if s/he does not stop?
If you have told your child that s/he is grounded for a period of time as a punishment, would s/he be let off (released, forgiven) before the time is up?
Do you let your child get away with things?
Does your child usually know how you will react or punish him/her when s/he has done something wrong?
If your child is punished, does the punishment work?
If a punishment has been decided upon, can your child change it by explanations, arguments, or excuses?
Do you and your partner agree with one another about how to bring up your child?
Do you disagree openly with your partner about how to discipline your child when your child is present?
Who really has the final say about disciplining your child?
Notes: 1=Your partner only; 2=Mostly your partner; 3=Yourself and your partner about equally; 4=Mostly yourself if have live in partner; 5=Yourself only; 6=Yourself/your partner/your child about equally; 7=Mostly your child; 8=Mostly yourself if no partner; 9=You and your child equally

ElementDescription: Does the kind of punishment you give your child depend on if you are in a good or bad mood?
Is the discipline you use effective for your child?
Do you feel you have found the right kind of discipline to deal with your child?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=In some situations; 2=Half of the time; 3=In most situations; 4=In all situations

ElementDescription: If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Take away a privilege or pocket money?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Send him/her out of the room?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Yell or scold?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Calmly discuss what happened?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Ignore it or not pay attention to it?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Slap or spank him/her or hit him/her with something?
If your child does something that s/he is not allowed to do or that you don't like, do you Tell him/her to get out or temporarily lock him/her out of the house?
Is there anything else you do when your child does something you do not like?
IF YES to 14h: How often?
IF YES to 14h: How often?

In the past year, how often have you Felt s/he was an affectionate child?

In the past year, how often have you Enjoyed spending time with him/her?
In the past year, how often have you Wished s/he would just leave you alone?

In the past year, how often have you Enjoyed being his/her parent?
In the past year, how often have you Felt s/he needed too much attention?
In the past year, how often have you Felt s/he was a happy child?
How many things would you like to change about him/her?
How well do you get along with him/her?
Notes: 1=Not well at all; 2=Not too well; 3=Okay; 4=Well; 5=Very well

ElementDescription: How well does your spouse/partner get along with your child?
Notes: 1=Not well at all; 2=Not too well; 3=Okay; 4=Well; 5=Very well

ElementDescription: Can you discuss your beliefs with your child without feeling restrained or embarrassed?
Do you sometimes have trouble believing everything that your child tells you?
Is your child a good listener?
Are you afraid to ask your child for what you want?
Does your child have a tendency to say nasty things to you that would be better left unsaid?

Are you very satisfied with how you and your child talk together?
If you were in trouble, could you tell your child?
Do you openly show affection to your child?
When you are having a problem with your child, do you give him/her the silent treatment?

When talking with your child, do you have a tendency to say things that would be better left unsaid?
When you ask your child questions, do you get honest answers?
Does your child try to understand your point of view?
Are there topics you avoid discussing with your child?

Does your child nag or bother you?
Does your child insult you when s/he is angry with you?

Does your child tell you about his/her personal problems?
Does your child keep his/her feelings to him/herself rather than talk about them with you?
Does your child hide being angry?
If your child is upset, do you prefer to send him/her outside or to another room?

If your child is upset, is it difficult for you to figure out whether s/he is angry, sad, scared, or what?
Does your child let things pile up without talking or dealing with then until they are more than you and s/he can handle?
Does your child let you know what is bothering him/her?
If your child is upset, do you find this out much later?
If your child is angry with you, do you hear about it from someone else?
Is your child free to say what s/he thinks in your family?
Are there certain topics which you do not allow your child to discuss with you?
Does your child admit mistakes without trying to hide anything?
Can your child have his/her say even if you disagree with him/her?
Do you and your child come to a solution when you talk about a problem?
Do you think that your child feels close to you?
Do you feel close to your child?
Overall, which of the following statements best describes your whole family?

In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Give him/her a wink or a smile?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Say something nice about it; praise or give approval?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Give him/her a hug, pat on the back, or a kiss for it?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Give him/her some reward for it, like a present, extra money, or something special to eat?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Give him/her a special privilege such as staying up late, or doing some special activity?

In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Do something special together, such as going to the movies, to a game, playing a game, or going somewhere?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Mention it to someone else?
In the past year, when your child did something that you liked or approved of, how often did you Ask him/her why s/he is not always good like this?
